programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 34
programme.desc: Belgian Rally Championship & FIM X-Trials Championship 2025.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes are still at the ski resort, preparing a spectacular stunt involving a station wagon that is catapulted 50 meters high into the air. The high-flying car is supposed to crash into another car that is placed on a meadow.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: This episode features the most spectacular classic body stunts: jumping from rooftops or the top of a driving cars, falling down staircases, and other potentially bone-breaking daredevilry, including fails and outtakes.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Rollovers, ramp jumps, crashes - there are thousands of ways to destroy cars, and the Stunt Heroes produce a lot of wrecks over the course of their adrenaline-filled job. It's a look back at the car stunt highlights of the past episodes.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: BMW F 800 R is a robust roadster with a lot of spirit, and even motorcycle world champions count on its agility. World champion, Chris Pfeiffer is showing just how much fun you can have with a BMW F 800 R. His work motorcycle is based on the version that you can buy.

programme.title: Ken Block - Gymkhana Grid
programme.desc: Spectacular drifts are to be expected when Ken Block visits the Gymkhana Grid.

programme.title: Ken Block at the Monza Rallye Show
programme.desc: In Monza, Ken Block is set to compete against Allstars from motorsport at the Monza Rally Show.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What are the characteristics of a typical German car? Do stereotypes like functionality, reliability but also a certain dullness paint a realistic picture? Also, we explored if the Volkswagen Golf GTE could bring new impulses to the brand's model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Slippery or muddy roads and bad visibility are circumstances that often spoil driving pleasure in winter. We took two almost identical Porsche 911's to an icy test track. Also: drifting fun in the snow with the Suzuki SX4 S-Cross.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: 4-door coupes combine the best of two worlds, the performance of a coupe and the style of a limousine. We took a closer look at three examples of this car subspecies, the Audi A7, BMW's 4 Series Gran Coupe, and the Mercedes-Benz CLA models.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The top-of-the-line specimens of a car model range are built for pure driving pleasure. We put the VW Golf R, the Audi TTS and the BMW M 235i to the test in order to see if they are worthy of bearing the crown of their model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: In 2015 Audi presented a facelift for their city racer A1. We put this compact to the test. Also: it's a tough competition in the compact class, and Renault and Peugeot also want a piece of the pie. We compared the Renault Twingo and the Peugeot 108.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The search for the fastest, best looking and best sounding car continues. Once more car lovers from the Middle East bring their tuned vehicles to the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach and have it judged by Saif Hattawi. The winner receives a special treat for two people from the luxurious Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette try to win the competition.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Put Your Car on TV gives every car owner the chance to bring their tuned machines to the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah beach. There, Saif Hattawi will assess each car based on speed, style and sound. The person with the most amazing car wins a one night stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. A BMW X6M, a massive Ford F250 and a special Nissan Patrol try to win this prize.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: Once more, Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi are on the hunst for the most amazing cars in the world and ask car owners to bring their customized vehicles to Dubai, where it will be awarded points based on speed, style and sound. The car with the points wins a stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. Among the presented cars are a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car on TV people from the Middle East present their tuned vehicles. They are rewarded with points based on its styling, the highest (possible) speed ever driven und naturally also its sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a luxurious treat from the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. This time, a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C are put on the spotlight.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: After its introduction the Audi RS6 was the benchmark when it came to extreme estate cars. The car's power and performance was already very impressive, but according to the Audi tuners that still wasn't enough. Their challenge was to improve something that was already great.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Do you want to feel like a race driver without being limited to a race track? If so, the British manufacturer Radical has the perfect solution for you. The company builds race cars with road approval. Their RXC is an extremely aggressive and agile racer. And the best thing about it is that it's street legal, but doesn´t feel like that at all.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: This episode focuses on the 6th generation of two US classics, the Ford Mustang GT and the Chevrolet Corvette Z06, at these iconic sports cars' history and development over the past decades.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: How do you top the already in many ways superior iconic Porsche 911? - You come up with the GT3. - The Porsche 911 GT3 with its 475 hp engine is the ultimate melange of road suitability and race track compatibility. And the German brand's RS model is even more intense when it comes to power, performance and ultimate sports car feel.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Ferrari's California T model heralded a new era for the Italian sports car manufacturer. After its facelift the T was the first Ferrari with a turbo engine since the iconic F40 which was built until 1992. Even manufacturers like Ferrari can’t avoid some downsizing once in a while, given this exclusive but highly competitive market segment.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Nowadays people associate the name Bentley with elegance and luxury, but the British brand also has another side. Since its establishment in 1919, Bentley consistently drew attention via its ongoing success in motor sports. The limited edition Continental GT3-R with less weight and more power than the regular model was one of the iconic manufacturer's sportiest cars ever.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: For more than 50 years the Porsche 911 has been holding the crown as one of the best sports cars in the world. But the competition still tries to overthrow the champion. Two manufacturers recently jousted with the 911 in order to lure customers away. The Jaguar F-Type R and the Mercedes AMG GT S are the Porsche’s strongest rivals.

programme.title: Cadillac Escalade
programme.desc: The Cadillac Escalade at first seems like a typical rather beefy American car, but this luxurious SUV is more of a lovable, gentle giant, that should be able to gain sympathy with its clientele.

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 34
programme.desc: Belgian Rally Championship & FIM X-Trials Championship 2025.

programme.title: Racetrack, Part 17
programme.desc: Today, we’re featuring the British GT Championship and the European Truck Racing Championship.

programme.title: Racetrack, Part 17
programme.desc: Today, we’re featuring the British GT Championship and the European Truck Racing Championship.
